pattern.name: Slope
pattern.description: Slope NOTE: Could calculate slope of two numerical attributes (in another pattern). NOTE: Whenever correlation is calculated manually, arithmetic overflow can happen. NOTE: DateToNumber function is automatically replaced with the database aware function call.
pattern.author: Jan Motl
pattern.code: SELECT @baseId , @baseDate , @baseTarget , (count(@numericalColumn)*sum(@numericalColumn*@timeColumn) - sum(@numericalColumn)* sum(@timeColumn))/(count(@numericalColumn)*sum(@numericalColumn*@numericalColumn) - sum(@numericalColumn)* sum(@numericalColumn)) AS "@columnName" FROM @propagatedTable WHERE dateDiff(@baseDate, @timeColumn) < @timeRange GROUP BY @baseId, @baseDate, @baseTarget

SELECT @baseId , @baseDate , @baseTarget , (count(@numericalColumn)*sum(@numericalColumn*@timeColumn) - sum(@numericalColumn)* sum(@timeColumn))/(count(@numericalColumn)*sum(@numericalColumn*@numericalColumn) - sum(@numericalColumn)* sum(@numericalColumn)) AS "@columnName" FROM @propagatedTable WHERE @timeColumn > DATE_ADD(@baseDate, INTERVAL -@timeRange day) GROUP BY @baseId, @baseDate, @baseTarget

SELECT @baseId , @baseDate , @baseTarget , regr_slope(@numericalColumn, dateToNumber(@timeColumn)) AS "@columnName" FROM @propagatedTable WHERE @timeColumn > (@baseDate -@timeRange) GROUP BY @baseId, @baseDate, @baseTarget
